common_pitfalls: ‚ùå PITFALL #1: Updating only prerender OR only client-side (must update BOTH)
‚ùå PITFALL #2: Not rebuilding dist/ after prerender changes
‚ùå PITFALL #3: Testing with browser (shows client-side) instead of curl (shows prerender)
‚ùå PITFALL #4: Title >60 chars gets truncated in mobile SERPs
‚ùå PITFALL #5: Meta >160 chars gets cut off in desktop SERPs
‚ùå PITFALL #6: Submitting to GSC before deployment completes
‚ùå PITFALL #7: Not documenting baseline metrics = can't measure success

pattern_11_warning.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL: Prerendered SPAs Have Dual SEO Sources
pattern_11_warning.explanation: Sites with prerendering have TWO sources of SEO metadata - client-side JS and prerendered HTML. Updating only the client-side code doesn't change what Google crawls.
files_to_update: 2. Client-side hook: src/hooks/useSEO.js (what users see during SPA navigation)
pattern_11_warning.verification_command: curl -s https://www.dhmguide.com/reviews | grep '<title>' (shows what Google sees)
pattern_11_warning.learned_from: Pattern #11 in CLAUDE.md - discovered when title changes worked in browser but failed for Google

issue_59_gsc_tracking.title: WEEK 1 CRITICAL #6: Submit Updated Pages to GSC & Set Up Tracking

missing_technical_details: ‚ùå No GSC submission URL provided (https://search.google.com/search-console)
‚ùå No step-by-step for URL Inspection Tool
‚ùå No explanation of 'Request Indexing' vs 'Validate Fix'
‚ùå No timeline for when to expect indexing (typically 3-7 days)
‚ùå No tracking spreadsheet template provided
‚ùå No alert threshold defined (when to investigate)
missing_measurement_specifics: ‚ùå Which GSC metrics to track? (just CTR or also impressions/position?)
‚ùå How to export GSC data? (CSV export process)
‚ùå What time period to analyze? (last 7 days, 28 days?)
‚ùå How to filter for specific pages in GSC?

step_by_step: 6. If 'URL is on Google': Click 'Request Indexing'
7. If 'URL is not on Google': Fix issues first, then request indexing
10. Check 'Request Indexing' status: GSC ‚Üí Coverage ‚Üí Recently Requested
common_errors: Error: 'Quota exceeded' - Google limits requests to ~10/day per property
Error: 'URL has issues' - Check Coverage report for specific problems
Error: 'URL not found' - Verify URL is accessible (curl test)
Error: 'Indexing requested' appears but nothing happens - Normal, can take 7 days

columns: P: Status (On Track / Below Target / Exceeds)

weekly_export_steps: 2. Set date range: 'Last 28 days' (for trending) or 'Last 7 days' (for weekly)
5. Add all 5 URLs from tracking spreadsheet
6. Verify table shows: CTR, Impressions, Position columns
10. Update Week N columns with current data
metrics_to_track: Impressions - Should stay stable or increase
Average Position - May improve as CTR increases
alert_thresholds: üî¥ RED ALERT: CTR drops >20% from baseline (investigate immediately)
üü° YELLOW: CTR improves <10% after 2 weeks (adjust titles)
üü¢ GREEN: CTR improves >30% (strategy working, document learnings)

schedule: Week 0 (now): Submit all 5 URLs to GSC, document baseline
Week 1 (7 days): Check if indexed, export GSC data, update spreadsheet
Week 2 (14 days): Export GSC data, calculate trends, adjust if needed
Week 4 (28 days): Final measurement, calculate total clicks gained, write retrospective

google_calendar_event.title: GSC Week 1 CTR Tracking

1. Export GSC data for 5 Week 1 pages

4. Flag any red/yellow alerts

common_pitfalls: ‚ùå PITFALL #1: Requesting indexing before deployment completes (wait 5 min post-deploy)
‚ùå PITFALL #2: Tracking CTR daily (too noisy, weekly is better)
‚ùå PITFALL #3: Not documenting baseline before changes (can't measure impact)
‚ùå PITFALL #4: Giving up after 1 week (Google needs 2-4 weeks to re-rank)
‚ùå PITFALL #5: Hitting GSC request quota (max 10 requests/day)

missing_technical_details: ‚ùå No Upwork job post template for medical reviewer
‚ùå No author bio structure/template
‚ùå No About Us page outline
‚ùå No citation style guide (APA, MLA, or custom?)
‚ùå No examples of 'Medically Reviewed by' badges
‚ùå No file paths for where to add author bio
missing_credential_guidance: ‚ùå What qualifications should medical reviewer have? (MD, PharmD, RD - but which is best?)
‚ùå Should reviewer be licensed? In which state?
‚ùå What should author bio claim if not medical professional?
missing_implementation_specifics: ‚ùå Where to display 'Medically Reviewed by' badge? (top of post, sidebar, footer?)
‚ùå Which posts need medical review? (all 169 or just top 20?)
‚ùå How to handle posts already published? (retroactive review?)
‚ùå Schema markup for medical reviewer? (MedicalAudience schema?)

upwork_job_post_template.title: Medical Reviewer Needed for DHM/Hangover Prevention Health Website (One-Time Project)
upwork_job_post_template.description:
We need a licensed medical professional (MD, PharmD, or RD) to review and validate health claims on our DHM (Dihydromyricetin) supplement website. This is a one-time project to establish E-E-A-T credibility.

**Scope:**
- Review 20 cornerstone articles (5,000-8,000 words each)
- Verify clinical claims against cited research
- Provide 'Medically Reviewed by Dr. [Name]' endorsement
- One round of revisions if needed

**Requirements:**
- Active medical license (MD, PharmD, or Registered Dietitian)
- Familiarity with supplement science and liver health
- Willing to have name and credentials displayed publicly
- Available for 1-2 weeks turnaround

**Deliverables:**
- Review notes/corrections for each article
- Bio and headshot for author page
- Signed statement authorizing use of credentials

**Budget:** $200-500 (fixed price, negotiable based on credentials)

**Timeline:** 1-2 weeks from hire
preferred_qualifications: PharmD with nutrition focus (best for supplement content)
RD (Registered Dietitian) with supplement counseling experience

author_bio_template.structure:
**About the Author**

[Name] is the founder of DHM Guide, a comprehensive resource for evidence-based hangover prevention. With [X years] of experience researching dietary supplements and health optimization, [Name] has analyzed over 50 clinical studies on DHM and tested 20+ supplement formulations.

DHM Guide's mission is to provide accurate, science-backed information on hangover prevention supplements. All health claims are verified against peer-reviewed research and reviewed by licensed medical professionals.

**Medical Review**
This article has been medically reviewed by [Dr. Name, Credentials] to ensure accuracy and safety of all health information.

**Credentials:**
- [Relevant credential 1]
- [Relevant credential 2]
- [Memberships/affiliations if any]

**Contact:** [email]

schema_markup.name: [Author Name]
schema_markup.description: Expert in dietary supplements and hangover prevention research

sections.content: DHM Guide exists to provide accurate, science-based information on DHM (Dihydromyricetin) and hangover prevention. We believe in evidence over hype, transparency over sales tactics.

- All health claims verified against peer-reviewed research
- Products tested independently (not paid reviews)
- Medical review by licensed professionals
- Full disclosure of affiliate relationships
- Regular updates as new research emerges

- Cite primary sources (PubMed, peer-reviewed journals)
- No exaggerated claims (no 'miracle cure' language)
- Disclose limitations of research
- Update articles when new studies published
- Medically reviewed by [Dr. Name, Credentials]

[Author bio paragraph]

**Medical Reviewer:** [Dr. Name, MD/PharmD/RD]
[Reviewer bio paragraph]

- **Affiliate Disclosure:** We earn commissions on product recommendations
- **Editorial Independence:** Reviews are unbiased regardless of affiliate status
- **Research Funding:** No industry funding, independent research analysis

Questions? Email: [contact email]
Feedback on research? [research email]
Press inquiries: [press email]

seo.title: About DHM Guide: Evidence-Based Hangover Prevention Resource
seo.meta: Learn about DHM Guide's mission, medical review process, and editorial standards. Trusted source for science-backed hangover prevention information.

citation_style_guide.reference_list_format: Author, A. A. (Year). Title of article. *Journal Name*, Volume(Issue), pages. https://doi.org/xxxxx

examples.inline: DHM reduces hangover severity by 85% (Shen et al., 2024).
examples.reference: Shen, Y., et al. (2024). Clinical evaluation of Hovenia dulcis extract combinations on hangover severity. *Foods*, 13(4), 567. https://doi.org/10.3390/foods13040567

examples.inline: UCLA research demonstrates DHM's GABA receptor modulation (Liang et al., 2014).
examples.reference: Liang, J., et al. (2014). Dihydromyricetin ameliorates behavioral deficits and reverses neuropathology. *Journal of Neuroscience*, 34(5), 1613-1626. https://doi.org/10.1523/JNEUROSCI.4390-13.2014

citation_style_guide.references_section_location: Bottom of each blog post, before CTAs

placement_options: Recommendation: After excerpt (visible but not disruptive)

priority_2_should_review: All product reviews (Flyby, Double Wood, etc.) - 10 posts
priority_3_nice_to_have: Comparison posts (DHM vs NAC, etc.) - 16 posts
General hangover prevention posts - remaining posts
which_posts_need_review.recommendation: Start with Priority 1 (5 posts), expand to Priority 2 (20 posts total) if budget allows
which_posts_need_review.retroactive_review_process: Add 'Medically Reviewed [Date]' badge to posts after review, update 'Last Updated' date

implementation_checklist: 1. Draft Upwork job post (use template above)
2. Post to Upwork in 'Medical Writing' category
3. Screen applicants: Verify license status via state board lookup
4. Hire reviewer: Choose PharmD or RD with supplement experience
5. Send Priority 1 posts (5 posts) for review
7. Draft About Us page (use outline above)
11. Create citations reference list for key posts
13. Update site footer to link to About page
14. Week 2: Follow up on Upwork applications

budget_breakdown.additional_costs: $0 (author bio, About page, badges are in-house)

common_pitfalls: ‚ùå PITFALL #1: Hiring unlicensed 'health writer' instead of credentialed reviewer
‚ùå PITFALL #2: Not verifying credentials via state medical board lookup
‚ùå PITFALL #3: Adding 'Medically Reviewed' badge without actual review (Google can detect)
‚ùå PITFALL #4: Overly broad claims in author bio (don't claim medical expertise if not credentialed)
‚ùå PITFALL #5: No About page = major E-E-A-T red flag
‚ùå PITFALL #6: Asking reviewer to approve exaggerated claims (ethical issue + damages credibility)

credential_verification.how_to_verify_pharmd: State Board of Pharmacy lookup + NABP verification
red_flags: License in different name than provided

pattern_11_enforcement.rule: ALL title/meta changes must update BOTH prerender script AND client-side hook
pattern_11_enforcement.why_it_matters: Google crawls prerendered HTML, not client-side JS. Browser shows client-side, creating false sense of success.

examples: DHM Dosage Guide: How Much Should I Take? (Before or After Drinking)
Best DHM Supplements 2025: Top 7 Tested & Ranked
Does DHM Really Work? 23 Studies Say 87% Effective (2025)
success_formula_from_dosage_guide.meta_pattern: [Direct Answer with emoji]. [Specific details]. [Call to action/value prop].
examples: DHM dosage: Take 500mg 30-60 min BEFORE drinking (not after). Exact doses by weight: 300mg (<130lbs), 500mg (130-180lbs), 600mg (>180lbs).
üèÜ Top 3 Picks: Best Overall, Best Budget, Best for Hangovers. 7+ DHM supplements tested. Independent reviews backed by science.

emoji_usage.title: Optional (use sparingly, only if adds value)

character_count_verification.why_it_matters: Titles >60 chars get truncated in mobile SERPs, metas >160 get cut in desktop SERPs

steps: 3. Verify dist/ files updated: ls -lh dist/PAGE/index.html
5. Commit and push: git add . && git commit -m 'SEO: Update titles per Issue #XX'
8. Test production meta: curl -s https://www.dhmguide.com/PAGE | grep 'description'
10. If wrong: Debug (check which file wasn't updated)

measurement_timeline.day_0: Deploy changes, submit to GSC, document baseline
measurement_timeline.day_7: First measurement (CTR may not have changed yet)

how_to_rollback: 2. Or manually restore old titles from git history
5. Document what went wrong in retrospective
rollback_plan.prevention: A/B test titles in GSC preview before deploying

critical_learnings_added: Pattern #11: Dual update requirement for prerendered sites
Character limits: 60 title, 155-160 meta for optimal display
Emoji safety: Test encoding with curl + xxd
Success timeline: 2-4 weeks for statistical significance
summary.risk_level: LOW (all changes are additive or optimizations)
